basics.name: Renay Brown
basics.label: DevOps & Cloud Engineer specializing in building scalable, resilient cloud infrastructure and automating deployment pipelines. Passionate about optimizing system performance, enhancing security, and streamlining CI/CD workflows to drive efficiency. Experienced in Kubernetes, cloud platforms like Azure and AWS, infrastructure-as-code, and monitoring solutions to ensure high availability and reliability. Committed to enabling seamless development and operational processes through automation and best practices.

summary.paragraph: I'm a cloud DevOps and Kubernetes engineer striving to make a mark in the cloud computing world. With experience in startup environments, I've streamlined deployments, optimized cloud infrastructure, and enhanced system reliability. My proactive problem-solving skills ensure scalable architectures, efficient automation, and seamless CI/CD workflows, delivering high-performance and resilient cloud solutions.

Fueled by my passion for automation and cloud efficiency, I design custom DevOps tools to optimize workflows, often solving challenges I encounter firsthand. I share my journey and insights on my personal blog, blending my expertise in cloud engineering, Kubernetes, and infrastructure as code with my commitment to continuous improvement.
My goal is to simplify and enhance people's lives through digital innovation, cultivating and expanding the INGCapaDev brand, and creating a lasting impact on the web development community.

work.name: Booz Allen
work.summary: At Booz Allen, I deployed, managed, and optimized CI/CD pipelines and Kubernetes-based infrastructure to support a zero-trust endpoint security platform. I integrated RabbitMQ to enable real-time streaming of user data and deployed PostgreSQL databases for secure and efficient data storage. I also automated deployments using Helm, Ansible, and GitLab CI, reducing manual effort and improving deployment speed. To enhance data availability, I implemented MinIO for replication, and I used Podman and Docker to develop and secure microservices. Additionally, I troubleshot network configurations using TCP/IP, monitored system performance with Grafana, and maintained highly available K3s clusters to ensure 99.9% uptime.

work.name: Lockheed Martin
work.summary: I designed and implemented CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure for enterprise virtual flight software running on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). To ensure high availability, I configured multiple node pools, enabled availability zones, and leveraged auto-scaling for resilience and scalability. I introduced GitOps practices with FluxCD, automating deployments and maintaining consistency across cluster environments. Using Python, Java, and C++, I enhanced business logic within the application to meet evolving requirements. Additionally, I developed GitLab pipeline stages in YAML, implemented code coverage tools like gcov and OpenCodeCoverage, and managed various Azure resources, including Virtual Desktops and pipeline runners. I optimized cloud spending by enforcing Azure policies, reducing yearly infrastructure costs by $20K. I also built Grafana dashboards to monitor pipelines, improving issue detection by 25%, and designed Azure Workbooks to track resource usage, cutting monthly expenses by $10K. Beyond cloud infrastructure, I assisted AI engineers in training image identification models and served as a part-time Scrum Master, facilitating agile ceremonies and improving communication across teams.

projects.name: Aura Series API
projects.description: API for Aura Series, a social media platform for sharing and discovering new series, with search and recommendation features.

projects.name: Personal Blog
projects.description: My personal blog where I share my experiences and knowledge about web development, productivity and other interesting topics.

projects.name: JB Baseball Game
projects.description: A baseball game simulator, which allow you to mark all the plays available in a baseball game and save a record of the players' plays.
